block.p: Mary Elizabeth Pratt and John Christopher Gustafsson were married yesterday by Canon John Luce at the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine in Manhattan.

Mr. and Mrs. Gustafsson work in Morristown, N.J., for Honeywell International, the manufacturing company. The bride, 40, is a vice president for electronic materials and the general counsel for that division. The bridegroom, 38, is the company's associate general counsel for litigation.
Mary Elizabeth Pratt and John Christopher Gustafsson were married yesterday by Canon John Luce at the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine in Manhattan.

Mr. and Mrs. Gustafsson work in Morristown, N.J., for Honeywell International, the manufacturing company. The bride, 40, is a vice president for electronic materials and the general counsel for that division. The bridegroom, 38, is the company's associate general counsel for litigation.

Mrs. Gustafsson graduated magna cum laude from Boston University and received a law degree from the University of Michigan. She is the daughter of Geraldine and James Pratt of Garden City, N.Y. Her father is a lawyer there.

Mr. Gustafsson graduated magna cum laude from Columbia and received a law degree cum laude from Harvard. He is the son of the late Jean Marie-Therese Gustafsson and Rune Gustafsson, who lived in St. George, Staten Island. His father, a merchant seaman, was a chief navigator with the International Organization of Masters, Mates and Pilots in Jersey City. The bridegroom's previous marriage ended in divorce.
